title: Interactive Map Loads and Displays User Location and Charging Stations
description: Verify that the interactive map loads correctly, showing the user's current position and all nearby EV charging stations with appropriate custom markers.

steps.description: Open the ChargeSure PWA in a supported browser with geolocation enabled.
Verify that the map centered correctly on the user's current location.
Verify that all EV charging stations within the viewport are displayed with custom markers.
Zoom and pan the map.
Verify that map markers update dynamically as the viewport changes.

title: Advanced Search and Filtering Functionality
description: Ensure the search bar returns relevant EV charging stations based on keyword, plug type, availability status, and user location with sorting options.

steps.description: Navigate to the search interface.
Enter a valid text query for station name or location.
Apply plug type filter to select specific plug types.
Apply availability filter to show only available chargers.
Select location-based sorting option (e.g., nearest first).
Verify the search results list and map markers match the filter criteria and query.
Verify that autocomplete suggestions appear as text is typed.

title: Station List Displays Detailed Information and Sorts Correctly
description: Check that the station list shows complete station details including distances and that sorting by distance and ratings works correctly.

steps.description: Open the station list component.
Verify each station item displays name, address, distance from user, number of chargers, and average rating.
Sort the list by distance ascending.
Verify that stations are correctly ordered by closest to farthest.
Sort the list by highest ratings.
Verify stations are ordered descending by average user rating.

title: Station Details Modal Displays Complete and Accurate Information
description: Verify that tapping a station marker or list item opens a modal showing charger specifications, user ratings, trust indicators, and recent updates accurately.

steps.description: Click on a station marker or select a station from the list.
Verify the modal opens and displays name, location, charger specs (plug types, power), and number of chargers.
Verify user ratings and feedback are visible and match backend data.
Verify trust indicators (verification badges or community flags) are displayed if applicable.
Close the modal.
Verify the modal closes without errors.

title: Charger Rating System Accepts and Reflects User Feedback
description: Confirm that users can submit star ratings and written feedback for individual chargers and that these ratings update in real time for all users.

steps.description: Open the charger rating interface for a specific charger.
Submit a valid star rating and accompanying text feedback.
Verify successful submission confirmation is shown.
Verify that the new rating is reflected immediately in the charger’s average rating.
Verify that the feedback appears in the user reviews list.
Attempt to submit invalid ratings or empty feedback.
Verify appropriate error messages appear and submission is blocked.

title: Real-time Status Update System Updates Charger Conditions Accurately
description: Ensure that users can report charger statuses (e.g., faulty, busy) and that these updates propagate in real time to other users’ views.

steps.description: Open the status update modal for a selected charger.
Submit a valid status update (e.g., 'Out of order' or 'Occupied').
Verify confirmation message for successful status update submission.
Verify that the updated status is reflected immediately in charger details for the reporting user.
In another client/session, verify that the updated status is also displayed in real time.
Attempt to submit an invalid or incomplete status update.
Verify appropriate error handling prevents submission and notifies the user.

title: Geolocation Services Display Accurate User Location and Provide Directions
description: Validate that the app correctly obtains the user’s current geolocation, calculates distances to stations accurately, and provides route directions.

steps.description: Grant location permissions when prompted.
Verify the user location appears on the map correctly.
Select a charging station and request directions.
Verify that navigation routes are calculated correctly and shown.
Select a station far from the user and verify the distance calculation.
Verify distance displayed matches expected geographic calculations.

title: Recent Locations Management Persists and Displays Recently Viewed Stations
description: Check that recently viewed stations are stored persistently in local storage and displayed accurately on relevant user interfaces.

steps.description: View details for multiple different charging stations.
Verify that each viewed station is added to the recent locations list.
Reload the app or close and reopen the browser.
Verify that recent locations are persisted and displayed correctly.
Clear recent location list using app interface if available.
Verify the recent locations list is cleared and local storage updated.

title: Offline Support Loads Cache and Provides Limited Functionality While Disconnected
description: Verify that the app loads cached data when offline, shows appropriate UI indicators, and performs with limited functionality without errors.

steps.description: Load the app online and navigate to multiple screens/stations.
Turn off network connection.
Verify the app loads previously cached data.
Verify the Offline indicator UI component is shown.
Attempt to perform a live status update or rating submission.
Verify graceful failure or queuing of actions with clear user messaging.
Navigate between cached screens.
Verify smooth navigation without crashes or errors.

title: PWA Installation Banner Appears and Installation Succeeds
description: Check that the PWA installation prompt banner is displayed appropriately on supported devices and that installation completes successfully.

steps.description: Access the app on a supported mobile browser.
Verify that the PWA installation banner appears after initial load.
Click on the install button in the banner.
Verify that the app installs as a PWA on the device.
Launch the installed app.
Verify the app opens correctly and supports offline mode.

title: User Interface Is Responsive and Accessible Across Devices
description: Ensure the UI correctly adapts to different screen sizes, orientations, and supports touch interactions with no usability or accessibility issues.

steps.description: Open the app on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices and resize window dynamically.
Verify components adjust layout properly, content is readable, and controls are reachable without horizontal scrolling.
Use touch gestures on mobile device for map navigation and list scrolling.
Verify touch interactions respond smoothly and UI elements have adequate size.
Use accessibility tools (keyboard navigation, screen readers) to interact with the app.
Verify appropriate ARIA labels, focus management, and no accessibility violations.

title: Error Handling Shows Friendly Messages and Recovers Gracefully
description: Validate that unexpected errors in map loading, station data fetching, or network failures show user-friendly error messages and do not crash the app.

steps.description: Simulate network failure or API errors during station data fetch.
Verify that a friendly error message is presented to the user.
Try to interact with broken components after error.
Verify the app remains responsive and allows retry or fallback actions.
Trigger an uncaught exception in UI components (e.g., forced error boundary).
Verify error boundary displays and recovers UI without crashes.

title: Analytics Capture User Events Accurately Without Performance Impact
description: Verify that user interactions such as searches, station views, and rating submissions are accurately tracked and sent to the analytics backend without degrading app performance.

steps.description: Perform multiple user actions including searches, station detail views, ratings submissions, and status updates.
Verify that analytic events corresponding to each action are logged and transmitted.
Check that the app responsiveness and load times remain consistent during intensive user interactions.
Disable analytics and verify no errors occur in the app.
Verify the app functions normally without analytics service.

title: Database Schema and Data Seeding Maintain Consistent and Complete Test Data
description: Validate database migration scripts and data seeding scripts create a consistent schema with valid seed data that supports all functional testing.

steps.description: Run database migration scripts on a clean PostgreSQL instance.
Verify all tables, indexes, and security policies are created as per schema.
Execute data seeding scripts to populate charging station, charger, and rating data.
Verify that seeded data matches expected structure and includes diverse test cases.
Query seeded data through Supabase API for key entities (stations, chargers, ratings).
Verify data integrity and referential constraints are maintained.
